description.narrative: Stöd till den tunisiska demokratiseringsprocessen med fokus på decentralisering, bland annat kapacitetsstöd till det nationella förbundet för tunisiska städer (Fédération Nationale des Villes Tunisiennes, FNVT).

Support to the Tunisian democratization process with a focus on decentralization and local governance, and a sepcial focus on supporting the capacity of the National Federation of Tunisian Cities (Fédération Nationale des Villes Tunisiennes, FNVT).

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Overall, the project has succeeded in reaching its intended outcomes of contributing to the local governance in Tunisia, of mobilization of local actors in the decentralization dialogue, of contributing to the strengthening of FNVT and of the output to explore the feasability of new pilot interventions in municipalities. SALAR has managed to established a good working relationship with both its partner FNVT and with the MoI with relevant and in demand activities and outputs as a result. The project started from a position where the partner FNVT had low recognition among the municipalities as a relevant representative for them against the central government. Quite the contrary, FNVT was struggling with its legacy from under the old regime where its function was more of an extended arm of the central government. During the project implementation time FNVT has managed to take important steps to redefine its role and responsabilities and to start winning the trust of the municipalities. The SALAR-funded project seem to have been a contributing factor to these changes with concrete support and help in building capacity, helpig setting up strategies and developing action plans and position papers as well as facilitating and supporting the working groups and consultation wit the different relevant actors. Some parts that the project/SALAR/FNVT has not managed to follow through on involves i particular the lobbying towards the relevant governement institution (submitting position papers etc). This has been due to that during the major part of the project there was a technical governement in place who was unwilling to take steps on different issues but rather prefered to wait for the democratically elected government. Therefor it has often been hard for the project/FNVT to find the relevant stakholder to address. This is however expected to be done once the new government and parliament is in place and have started to work. The project has included civil society in its different activities and as part of the FNVT Working Group. It has also tried to coordinate with internationa actors/intiatives also active within the field.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
